data.title: Sidebar size keeps increases when clicking on right edge of Explorer panel
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.7.1 stable
- OS Version: Win 10

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open Explorer side panel
2. Double click on panel right edge
3. Repeat step 2

data.title: Provide a unified, secure, credential store
data.body:
At the moment, extension who need access to various resources need to implement their own credential storage, e.g. for storing tokens. For example, the VSTS extension does this, and what we want to implement in the (community-driven) Azure tools for Vscode, also looks like we'd need to it, to avoid having users sign-in into Azure every single session.

What I'd expect, is the platform (Vscode) to provide a unified interface for secure credential service (ideally something that looks like this: https://github.com/Microsoft/vsts-vscode/blob/master/src/credentialstore/credentialstore.ts)

data.title: Hotkey for dotnet.test.debug command doesn't work
data.body:
## Steps to reproduce
Use this keybindings.json:
```json
[
    {
        "key": "alt+f5",
        "command": "dotnet.test.debug"
    }
]
```
Set breakpoint inside test method, point the cursor inside the test method and hit Alt+F5.

P.S.: Don't offer me to use mouse and click "debug test" link. I like to hide reference info links and use hotkeys to execute an actions.

## Expected  behavior
Current test executed in debug mode as it happes when I click "debug test" link above this test method.

## Actual behavior
Debug session doesn't started.

## Environment data
`dotnet --info` output:
.NET Command Line Tools (1.0.0-preview2-003133)

Product Information:
 Version:            1.0.0-preview2-003133
 Commit SHA-1 hash:  74df06500c

Runtime Environment:
 OS Name:     Windows
 OS Version:  10.0.14393
 OS Platform: Windows
 RID:         win10-x64

|Theme-Monokai-Contrast|gerane|0.0.2|

---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. go to menu - open directory
2.dialog for opening directory loads too slow, like 10 seconds or more to open

data.title: Autocompletion should have fallback to simple matching
data.body:
Atom has a nice behaviour where autocompletion can fall back to a simple string-matching mode that matches terms within the same document, which is extremely useful to reduce typing even though there's no grammar.

In my opinion, this should be available even when the current scope has a grammar, such as Go. For example, one thing I do all the time is write a call to a function before I've defined that function. So I'll do something like:

```go
func main() {
  loadDataFromFile()
}

// Then I start typing:
func loadD
```

Even though there's no function `loadDataFromFile` defined yet, the autocompletion _should_ offer it as a match for `loadD`, because it's in the file. (Having a "create function loadDataFromFile" command at the call site would obviously be even better, but this is just one example of many.)

This kind of autocompletion is also super useful in purely-plaintext or other non-grammatical scopes, including comments, Markdown, and so on.

data.title: Improve REPL link highlight regexp
data.body:
Fixes the issues I discovered after #15174 was merged.

#15174 added the ability to match relative paths by making the "root" path component optional. Unfortunately, since paths can contain spaces, that meant there was no leading "terminator" for the path anymore, so all whitespace and "at" before a relative path matched too:

![bug](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/10532611/20221907/8efaca9c-a833-11e6-92c6-1040f0de7f53.png)

This is resolved by requiring terminators at the start and end, which are line start/end, `at `, brackets or quotes.

The capture group that previously captured the "root" path component is not captured anymore (it was not used) and can now either be a unix root slash, a window drive letter component OR the beginning of a relative path, which cannot contain spaces.

## Known issues:
Cannot match a relative path where the first component contains a space, like this:
```
     at what ever\test.js:20
```
Seems impossible to me without using look-around assertions.

Relative paths still cannot be opened, need to be resolved to absolute, don't know how.

https://regex101.com/r/xkAp3A/1

data.title: Support for empty editor groups
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.7.1

Really annoying thing: I want to open new file [to the side](https://code.visualstudio.com/Docs/editor/codebasics#_side-by-side-editing). When I do that, it shows the same file. When I use `Ctrl+P`, newly created, duplicated file, stays in background.

Steps to Reproduce:

1.  Go to any file
2.  Press `Ctrl+\`
3. The same file opens up as I've been to. When I then use `Ctrl+P` to open another one, it stays in background.

[Video of how it looks like](https://gfycat.com/GreatShabbyGoldeneye)

What I propose:

1. Don't open the same file after using `Ctrl+\` (why would I want to have a file opened two times?). Show blank space instead.
2. Or at least close this file when I use `Ctrl+P` to open another one.

data.title: When in Run/Debug Mode, Stop does not switch back to Design Mode
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.7.1
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:

1.  Load up any well formed, error free, node.js Typescript project.
2. Fit F5. VS.Code switches to Debug Mode
3. Hit the red Stop button on the debug transport.

BUG: We're still in Run/Debug Mode, even though program execution has stopped.

data.title: Visual Studio implementation of "Home"/"End" keys

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.7.1
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:

1.  select multiple lines of text so that the cursor is then at the first line of the selection (select from the bottom up)
2.  press the "End" key.

In regular Visual Studio, the cursor navigates to the end of the selection.
In VS Code the cursor navigates to the end of the current (first) line.

I think it should behave as in regular Visual Studio - when trying to copy/paste some CSS class definition I always end up pasting the code into the code I was copying from...

Is there maybe a key-binding command for "go to end of selection"?

data.title: Go (golang) Auto Complete (Half) Works
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.7.1
- OS Version: Ubuntu 14.04

Steps to Reproduce:

Can't provide steps to reproduce. It happens spontaneously. Others had this issue too (on gitter).

The default gocode auto built option is not changed: `"go.gocodeAutoBuild": true`.
And I have these personal settings (just FYI; and I do not know if they matter in this matter):
```
// Place your settings in this file to overwrite the default settings
{
    // Is git enabled
    "git.enabled": false

    , // Migrated from previous "File | Auto Save" setting:
    "files.autoSave": "afterDelay",

    // Controls the delay in ms after which a dirty file is saved automatically. Only applies when "files.autoSave" is set to "afterDelay"
    "files.autoSaveDelay": 2000
}
```

And I have this script `rs-gocode`:
```
#!/bin/bash

gocode close
gocode
```
But it does not help (Should I run it inside current directory?).

Sometimes after login/logout or restart, the problem goes away and the problem is mostly with code that is currently being written (it compiles & passes the tests - not broken).
